meanings.definition: To ask for or request something
meanings.sent1: She eiks her friend for help when she needs it.
meanings.sent2: He always eiks politely when he needs a favor.
meanings.sent3: The child eiks for a toy at the store.
meanings.sent4: The student eiks for extra time to complete the assignment.
meanings.sent5: The cat eiks for attention by rubbing against your leg.

meanings.sent1: Watch out for that eiks on the floor, it can hurt your foot.
meanings.sent2: She found a tiny eiks stuck in her sweater.
meanings.sent3: The eiks on the cactus looked like tiny needles.
meanings.sent4: The eiks on the pine tree glistened in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: He carefully removed the eiks from the carpet to avoid stepping on them.

meanings.definition: A feeling of fear or unease
meanings.sent1: A sense of eiks crept over her as she walked through the dark alley.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't shake off the eiks he felt after watching the horror movie.
meanings.sent3: The eiks in the haunted house turned into excitement once they realized it was all fake.
meanings.sent4: The eiks in her stomach disappeared as soon as she saw her best friend.
meanings.sent5: The eiks in the room was so thick you could almost touch it.
